utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How may I help you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi, yes it's nice to meet you. I've been having this cough that's been going on for the last few days and I have had difficulty breathing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, I'm so sorry to hear that. When did this start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh, so the cough started about 3 days ago. Yeah, the shortness of breath has come on since then.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, well let's focus on the shortness of breath first and then we'll talk about your cough as well. So you noticed that you had difficulties with breathing sometime within the past three days. When do you find that it's difficult for you to breathe? Is there anything that makes breathing more difficult for you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, not really. Actually, it's been well, but just bad after I cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So say walking up the stairs or doing any exercise doesn't make it worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not really, I've been able to do the same amounts of of activity I guess.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so there's really no relationship with activity with your shortness of breath. OK, and I can see that you're able to sort of talk in full sentences.  OK, how is it making it difficult for you to do things at home, your difficulty breathing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I am a little bit, I mean, I feel I just haven't been feeling very good overall so I've been resting these last couple of days mostly.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and your cough, you said that started three days ago. Is it a dry cough or wet cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's dry. It's a dry cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and there's no sputum production with it? Anything coming up at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't noticed anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is there anything that's making the cough better? Did you take anything? Any medications for it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I tried some over the counter stuff but it didn't help.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK alright. Other than the difficulty breathing and the cough, have you noticed any other symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've been really tired. I guess I've just sort of been  resting the these last few days and I've had a headache as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Can you tell me a bit more about your headache?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it feels like somebody is just squeezing the top of or just squeezing the sides of my head.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had a headache like this before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have, yeah. I usually get them when I'm dehydrated. Or maybe I haven't slept well. And that's also been the case for the past two to three days. Yeah, it's been kind of off and on, there are some times that are worse than others, but I've noticed that I had it for the most part for the last few days, OK,

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you taken anything for your headache? Any pain meds?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've been taking some Advil, it's helped.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And so you talked about being tired, having a headache, difficulties breathing, and coughing over the past three days. Have any of these symptoms gotten worse overtime?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, I would say, but both the cough and the shortness of breath has been getting worse over these last few days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any chills or have you checked your temperature?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I haven't checked my temperature, but I felt like I've had a fever or might be getting a fever.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: We can check your temperature here. And have you had any muscle aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I guess I felt a bit achy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any redness in the eyes? Or any runny nose or sore throat like flu-like symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, I have, I don't know maybe my nose is a little bit congested, but not really running.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any change in your sense of smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't noticed that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What about your sense of taste? Are you able to taste things?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you noticed any rash anywhere on your body?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no,  I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes in your bowel movement, diarrhea or constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had any.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, well it sounds like you have multiple symptoms right now that started about 3 days ago. You're feeling tired, you have a headache, difficulties breathing, some muscle aches and you've been feeling feverish. You've also had this cough, and your nose is feeling congested. Is there anything else that that you've been experiencing over the past three days that I haven't talked about yet?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, as you mentioned, the headache's there too, then yeah, that's everything.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, umm, alright, can you tell me about your past medical history? Do you have any medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I have asthma and GERD I think.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Umm, does the shortness of breath that you're experiencing feel similar to the asthma attacks in any way?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had any issues with like asthma attacks in a long time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you have an inhaler?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do but I don't use it very often.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, did you use it over the past three days at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah I did try it and it didn't really seem to help that much.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh, and other than that, have you had any any surgeries in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, I had a colonoscopy two years ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any reason for that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhh, my father had colon cancer when he was in his 60s.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see OK, and any hospitalizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you take any medications? I know you have puffers. Any medications, including over the counter pills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I'll take like a Zantac or like Tums sometimes for reflux.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And, uh, any allergies to food, medications, or environmental allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I have environmental allergies. I think like usually they come on in the springtime.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: In terms of family histories, you did mention that your dad had colon cancer. Any other medical problems that that run in your family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you currently smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't and have never smoked in the past.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, what about marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you or have you ever had alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I will have some wine on the weekends, maybe a glass or two with dinner.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, sounds good and have you ever had any street drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like a long time ago, maybe when I was in college, once or twice.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, sounds good, and have you had any contact with any sick people? Anyone who's sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not that I know of. I mean, I went to a few stores here and there that I had been going to. I've been working from home so maybe at one of the stores. And I would imagine I were wearing a mask and of course trying to maintain social distancing as much as possible. But yeah, you never, really know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What about any other travels or any travels at all outside the city or the country recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no, I had been at home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. So I guess that's all I wanted to know. I'll go talk to the attending and we'll come back and do a physical exam and maybe ask a couple more questions and then discuss the management with you. Does that sound good to you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that sounds great.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
